meanings.sent1: The underreported information led to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent2: The underreported data skewed the results of the study.
meanings.sent3: It was underreported how many cookies were actually eaten at the party.
meanings.sent4: The underreported impact of the storm caught many by surprise.
meanings.sent5: The underreported facts were finally brought to light.

meanings.definition: To report less than the actual amount or extent.
meanings.sent1: She underreported her expenses on the financial report.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to underreported their losses to avoid scrutiny.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally underreported the number of guests invited to the party.
meanings.sent4: The journalist chose to underreported the controversial details of the story.
meanings.sent5: The student was caught when he tried to underreported his quiz score.
